III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted one corrective action plan (CAP) during this period under
review. The agency Renewal Inspection was completed on 5/28/23 and the CAP
was approved on 5/31/23. The agency was cited for one violation. There were no
2

repeat violations during this reporting period. The agency is following their
corrective action plan.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator was interviewed regarding her chief administrator
assessment. She reported the agency foster care program has recently opened.
The administrator has been working with staff on processes and procedures.
During the agency’s last licensing inspection signed on 5/28/23, the agency was in
violation with policy FOM 801-03 medical passport. The agency submitted an
acceptable corrective action plan which was addressed appropriately.
Financial Overview
The agency certified independent auditor’s report dated December 20,2022, and
the agency annual financial budget was reviewed. There were no financial
concerns identified.
Staff Interviews
The staff members interviewed reported being supported and assisted by their
coworkers and management. They love working at the agency.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The office appears to have adequate space and equipment for the staff members
to complete their required responsibilities. Physical CHRI and case files are all
stored securely, preventing unauthorized access. No concerns were noted.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns during this reporting period.
3

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
